ComplexType.Name: AppointmentProposal
ComplexType.Description: Represents a proposed appointment time and date as a result of the Search Action.

Properties.Property: The proposed appointment start date and time.
The proposed appointment end date and time.
The ID of the site for the proposed appointment.
The name of the site for the proposed appointment.
An array of parties needed for the proposed appointment.

ComplexType.Name: AppointmentRequest
ComplexType.Description: Provides the details of an appointment request for the Search action.

Properties.Property: The ID of the service to search for.
The time offset in minutes, from midnight, when the first occurrence of the appointment can take place
The time zone code of the user who is requesting the appointment.
The time, in minutes, for which the appointment recurrence is valid.
A value to override the time zone that is specified by the UserTimeZoneCode property.
The appointments to ignore in the search for possible appointments.
The resources that are needed for this appointment.
The date and time to begin the search.
The date and time to end the search.
the date and time for the first possible instance of the appointment.
The recurrence rule for appointment recurrence.
The appointment duration, in minutes.
Any additional constraints.
The scheduling strategy that overrides the default constraints.
The direction of the search.
The number of results to be returned from the search request.
The sites where the requested appointment can take place.

ComplexType.Name: AppointmentsToIgnore
ComplexType.Description: Specifies the appointments to ignore in an appointment request from the Search action.

Properties.Property: An array of IDs of appointments to ignore.
The resource for which appointments are to be ignored.

ComplexType.Name: AttributeMapping
ComplexType.Description: This type doesn’t have any extensibility scenarios in this release.

Properties.Property: For internal use only.
For internal use only.
For internal use only.
For internal use only.
For internal use only.
For internal use only.
For internal use only.
For internal use only.
For internal use only.
For internal use only.
For internal use only.
For internal use only.

ComplexType.Name: AttributePrivilege
ComplexType.Description: Specifies the field level security privileges allowed for an attribute.

Properties.Property: The ID of the attribute.
Indicates whether creation of the attribute value is allowed.
Indicates whether read of the attribute value is allowed.
Indicates whether update of the attribute value is allowed.

ComplexType.Name: AuditPartitionDetail
ComplexType.Description: Identifies a Microsoft SQL Server partition that is used to store changes to entity data records.

Properties.Property: The sequence (serial) number of the partition.
The creation date and time of the first audit record in the partition.
The end date and time for the last audit record in the partition.
The size, in bytes, of the partition.

ComplexType.Name: BookResponse
ComplexType.Description: Contains the response from the Book action.

Properties.Property: For internal use only.
The appointment validation results.

ComplexType.Name: BooleanManagedProperty
ComplexType.Description: Defines a managed property that stores a Boolean value.

Properties.Property: The value of the managed property.
Indicates whether the managed property value can be changed.
The logical name for the managed property.

ComplexType.Name: BusinessNotification
ComplexType.Description: For internal use only.

Properties.Property: For internal use only.
For internal use only.
For internal use only.

ComplexType.Name: BusinessNotificationParameter
ComplexType.Description: For internal use only.

Properties.Property: For internal use only.
For internal use only.

ComplexType.Name: CheckIncomingEmailResponse
ComplexType.Description: Contains the response from the CheckIncomingEmail action.

Properties.Property: The reason for the result in the ShouldDeliver property.
A value that indicates whether the message should be delivered to Microsoft Dynamics CRM.

ComplexType.Name: CheckPromoteEmailResponse
ComplexType.Description: Contains the response from the CheckPromoteEmail action.

Properties.Property: The reason for the result in the ShouldPromote property.
A value that indicates whether the message should be promoted to Microsoft Dynamics CRM.

ComplexType.Name: ColumnSet
ComplexType.Description: Specifies the attributes for which non-null values are returned from a query.

Properties.Property: Indicates whether to retrieve all the attributes of a record.
Gets the collection of Strings containing the names of the attributes to be retrieved from a query.

ComplexType.Name: ConstraintRelation
ComplexType.Description: Specifies additional constraints to be applied when you select resources for appointments.

Properties.Property: the ID of the calendar rule to which the constraint is applied.
The type of constraints.
The set of additional constraints.

ComplexType.Name: EndpointCollection
ComplexType.Description: A collection of service endpoints.

Properties.Property: The number of elements in the collection.
A value indicating whether the data collection (a collection of keys and values) is read-only.
A collection containing the keys in the data collection.
A collection containing the values in the data collection.

ComplexType.Name: EntityKeyMetadata
ComplexType.Description: Represents the metadata for an entity alternate key.

Properties.Property: The label containing the display name for the entity alternate key.
The logical name for the entity alternate key.
The schema name for the entity alternate key.
The logical name for the entity the alternate key is associated with.
The entity attributes which constitute the entity alternate key.
The property that determines whether the entity alternate key is customizable.
Indicates whether the entity alternate key is part of a managed solution.
A string identifying the solution version that the entity alternate key was added in.
A unique identifier for the metadata item.
Indicates whether the item of metadata has changed.

ComplexType.Name: ErrorInfo
ComplexType.Description: Specifies the results of a scheduling operation using the Validate, Book, or Reschedule action.

Properties.Property: The array of information about a resource that has a scheduling problem for an appointment.
The reason for a scheduling failure.

ComplexType.Name: Label
ComplexType.Description: A collection of translations for a label.

Properties.Property: The collection of localized labels.
The label for the language of the current user.

ComplexType.Name: LocalizedLabel
ComplexType.Description: A localized label, including the label string and the language code.

Properties.Property: The localized label string.
The language code for the label.
Indicates whether the label is managed.
A unique identifier for the metadata item.
Indicates whether the item of metadata has changed.

ComplexType.Name: MailboxTrackingFolderMapping
ComplexType.Description: Stores data about what folders for a mailbox are auto tracked.

Properties.Property: The ID of the Microsoft Exchange folder that is tracked.
The name of the Microsoft Exchange folder that is tracked.
The ID of a record that the folder is regarding.
The name of entity that is represented by the regarding object ID.
The type of entity that is represented by the regarding object ID.
Indicates whether the folder has been on boarded for auto tracking.

ComplexType.Name: ObjectiveRelation
ComplexType.Description: Describes the scheduling strategy for the Appointment action and that overrides the default constraints.

Properties.Property: The ID of the resource specification.
The search strategy to use in the appointment request for the Search action.

ComplexType.Name: OrganizationDetail
ComplexType.Description: Provides detailed information on an organization.

Properties.Property: The global unique identifier of the organization.
The friendly name of the organization.
The version of the organization.
The organization name used in the URL for the organization Web service.
The unique name of the organization.
A collection that identifies the service type and address for each endpoint of the organization.
The state of the organization.

ComplexType.Name: OrganizationResources
ComplexType.Description: Specifies resources used by an organization.

Properties.Property: The current number of active users.
The maximum number of active users.
The current number of non-interactive users.
The maximum number of non-interactive users.
The current number of custom entities.
The maximum number of custom entities.
The current number of published workflows.
The maximum number of published workflows.
The current storage used by the organization.
The maximum storage allowed for the organization.

ComplexType.Name: PagingInfo
ComplexType.Description: Specifies a number of pages and a number of entity instances per page to return from the query.

Properties.Property: The number of pages returned from the query.
The number of entity instances returned per page.
The total number of records should be returned from the query.
The info used to page large result sets.

ComplexType.Name: ProposalParty
ComplexType.Description: Represents a party (user, team, or resource) that is needed for the proposed appointment.

Properties.Property: The ID of the resource that is represented by this party.
The ID of the resource specification that is represented by this party.
The display name for the party.
The logical name of the type of entity that is represented by this party.
The percentage of time that is required to perform the service.

ComplexType.Name: RequiredResource
ComplexType.Description: Specifies a resource that is required for a scheduling operation.

Properties.Property: The ID of the required resource.
The ID of the required resource specification.

ComplexType.Name: RescheduleResponse
ComplexType.Description: Contains the response from the Reschedule action.

Properties.Property: The validation results for the appointment, recurring appointment master, or service appointment (service activity).
For internal use only.

ComplexType.Name: ResourceInfo
ComplexType.Description: Specifies information about a resource that has a scheduling problem for an appointment.

Properties.Property: the ID of the record that has a scheduling problem.
The display name for the resource.
The logical name of the entity.

ComplexType.Name: RolePrivilege
ComplexType.Description: Contains information about a privilege.

Properties.Property: The depth of the privilege.
The ID of the privilege.
The ID of the business unit.

ComplexType.Name: SearchResults
ComplexType.Description: Contains the results from the Search action.

Properties.Property: The set of proposed appointments that meet the appointment request criteria.
The information regarding the results of the search.

ComplexType.Name: TimeInfo
ComplexType.Description: Specifies a set of time blocks with appointment information.

Properties.Property: The start time for the block.
The end time for the block.
The value that indicates whether the time block is available, busy, filtered, or unavailable.
Information about the time block such as whether it is an appointment, break, or holiday.
The ID of the record referred to in the time block.
The ID of the calendar for this block of time.
The type of entity referred to in the time block.
The value that indicates whether the block of time refers to an activity.
The status of the activity.
The amount of effort required for this block of time.
The display text shown in the calendar for the time block.

ComplexType.Name: TimeInfoCollection
ComplexType.Description: The results of the search, a set of possible time slots for the resource.

Properties.Property: An array of TimeInfo items.

ComplexType.Name: TraceInfo
ComplexType.Description: Specifies the results of a scheduling operation using the Validate, Book, Reschedule, or Search action.

Properties.Property: The list of error information for the scheduling operation.

ComplexType.Name: ValidationResult
ComplexType.Description: Contains the result from the Validate, Book, or Reschedule action.

Properties.Property: The value that indicates whether the appointment or service appointment was validated successfully.
The reason for any scheduling failures.
The ID of the validated activity.

ComplexType.Name: WhoAmIResponse
ComplexType.Description: Contains the response from the WhoAmI action.

Properties.Property: The ID of the user who is logged on.
The ID of the business to which the logged on user belongs.
The ID of the organization that the user belongs to.
